name: W New York

reviews.title: Hip and a bit of alright
reviews.text: The W caters to an urban crowd that probably likes the grass growing out of the walls and the chic black shirts and pants of the wait staff. They don't give away the rooms, but the bedding is comfortable and everything works. You get a good night sleep on a king bed with nice white sheets. My wife and I enjoyed ourselves. We chuckled at the slimming mirrors that are placed just across from the elevators when you get off of each floor.

reviews.title: Try Somewhere Else
reviews.text: If you want to be treated rudely, stay in a small room at an extremely high price, the W New York is for you. To top it off, they don't tell you that it costs $45 to park overnight, then add it to your bill later with no warning. When I called about the $45 charge they offered no apology and no offer to reduce or eliminate the charge (which is truly outrageous.) And I'm a Starwood Platinum member!

reviews.title: overrated
reviews.text: I've stayed in NYC many times so this isn't sticker shock. I'd look elsewhere. I recommend the Stanhope Park Hyatt.

We were so disappointed from the moment we arrived. It took us 20 minutes to register. They put us in a smoking cubicle (I can't call it a room. One inch smaller and we could have sued for cruel and unusual punishment) even though we would never have booked a smoking room. The bathroom barely fit one person and you had to achieve contortionist proportions to reach the toilet paper. No one ever answered the concierge or main desk phone any time we tried. The only bright spot is comfortalbe and visually interesting bar downstairs and the music CD which they have available to listen to in the room although CD has remained the same for over 1 1/2 years. Toiletries stink -- they make you buy them instead of offering them for free. All in all not anywhere worth the price.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere for less $$$
Meh...
reviews.text: I stayed here one night during this past week in March. I chose this hotel because the AAA rate that I could get made it comparable in price to the Waldorf across the street and the Marriot next door. Having stayed at both before, I thought I'd give the W a try. Big mistake.

I stayed here for one night, 2/9/07, and was very pleasantly surprised. I arrived at 6:30 on a Friday night and the place was buzzing. That may turn a lot of people off, but on a Friday night during Fashion Week, I'd be disappointed if it wasn't. The staff at check-in could not have been more pleasant. I am a Starwood Gold member, and maybe that's why they were so nice, but it was as smooth a process as I've ever had. I even received a call about 20 minutes after I got into my room to see if everything was okay. The concierge (Wherever, Whenever) tried to help change some hard-to-get dinner reservations without any luck, but at least he tried.
reviews.title: Definitely not for everyone!

likes.liked: — large comfortable room and especially front desk staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was large and very comfortable, and the bathroom was, by NYC standards, a pretty good size. My only complaints were the shower cap that was never brought by housekeeping and the door men, who were not much help in at all. No one opened the car door on arrival and not one of them offered help in carrying my bag into the hotel. There were several gypsy town cars out front blocking cabs from picking up fares and I saw one of the drivers hand the doorman some money in exchange for this "service". When I left he following day, I had to hail my own taxi - the door men were nowhere to be found. The door staff at the Union Square W were much more professional and helpful.
reviews.title: The best NYC experience.
Gross
reviews.text: Also, the spa is okay, but not nearly as good as the original Bliss downtown. I had to wait almost 1/2 hour for my service because the client before me was late, and the desk staff said nothing - they just let me sit there the entire time offering me bottled water. They could have at least told me the cause of the delay.
Oh, and the elevators are very, very slow and very very small.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay - Have These Other People Ever Traveled?

reviews.text: My husband and I loved the hotel. I had been reading the reviews for months and even tried to cancel because the reviews were so bad. The reviews were wrong. The hotel was great. The service, room, drinks and the location. In fact I felt like we were in the best part of the city. My room was a great size the bliss products smelled great. I would stay here again and recommend it.
reviews.title: Poor excuse for a hotel
W as in Westin
reviews.text: If you take away the impeccable W Hotel service ethos of the team (front desk, concierge, bar staff and room service crews) what you're left with is a pretty standard, 4-star NYC hotel.

reviews.title: World Class Service at W New York (Midtown)
reviews.text: My 'spectacular' room was much smaller than at other W hotels I've stayed in, the styling of the room was functional and not as design-centric as the rest of the chain. The walls are paper thin, so expect to hear every flush and conversation of next door.

reviews.title: It got even better since six months ago...
reviews.text: I felt like I was staying in a Le Meridien or a Sheraton, so maybe Starwood should just rebrand this hotel and charge a more appropriate rate.

reviews.title: location
reviews.text: The W Midtown exceeded all expectations! The hotel is beautiful and centrally located in Midtown in a beautiful and VERY safe area of the city. Midtown allows travelers easy access to Uptown or Downtown and is close to most major tourist destinations in the city. The Hotel is modern and the entire staff I encountered was friendly and customer oriented. I had traveled in by RED EYE and the staff did their best to accomodate my request for an early check in. The restaurants were top notch and the lobby bar was packed with fun and interesting guests from all over the world. Guests never have to leave the hotel to have a New York experience with the atmosphere in the Restaurant and Lobby Bar-great People Watching!!!

reviews.title: Loved Our Stay - Great Service!
reviews.text: The Whiskey Bar is still a popular night spot and is open LATE!!!!

We were so excited to escape for a romantic evening. What a joke! We had an issue checking in: booked with my husband's cc and then were intially refusing to let me check-in, even though I was willing to use my card as a security. First room was on Lexington- Way to NOISY. The second room that was offered was described as a room on the floor with the atrium. We looked out onto the interior service area of the building (heating and cooling systems, etc). It was a beautiful sunny day and it looked like a gray, cold day in our room because that's how little sunlight reached our room!
reviews.title: What a huge disappointment!

likes.liked: — Chic lobby where you could never find a seat
likes.disliked: — the service, the rooms and the price

reviews.text: The rooms are VERY SMALL and the walls are paper thin. I was awoken several times throughout the night by people passing by the room and talking (and I am not a light sleeper).
reviews.title: BARBIE sized - stay elsewhere!

likes.liked: — Staff was great, location is ok.

reviews.text: Outrageously overpriced for the quality. The hotel is all hype.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel in NYC, Great Location for Mid & Uptown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for a conference so we didn't have a choice where we stayed - If you do have a choice - choose another hotel.
reviews.title: Hair and barking dogs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband put it best - it's Barbie sized! The rooms are TOO small. We shuffled around trying not to bump into each other! Our bathroom only had a shower - no tub and the beds are queen-sized and not very comfortable. It seems the more you pay for a property the less you get. No coffee in the room - 2 in the lobby will set you back $7.00.
reviews.title: Room was too small, hotel itself quite nice. Overpriced!

reviews.text: We booked a "cozy" room in this hotel on Hotwire for $364 total for two nights (May 10 & 11) .When we found out it was the W at 50th and Lex, we were a little apprehensive because the reviews were not so great. We needn't have worried.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations. Great service makes it stand out.

reviews.text: The location is excellent for what we wanted to do - museums, shopping, people-watching, friend-visiting, and general relaxation. One block from the 6 train. Easy to zip up to the museums on the Upper East Side or for shopping on Soho. Rockefeller Center is a short walk away. I had to go to Cobble Hill in Brooklyn and that was a breeze as well.
reviews.title: Best stay of many at this W but that's not saying much

reviews.text: Check-in was very welcoming. We got there at the prime-check in time at 3 PM after a 5 hour bus ride. There were only three people ahead of us, but someone swooped in and offered us a bottle of water and apologized for the wait. The clerk, Jason, was enthusiastic and super-friendly (not alweays the case when you book through a discount site), very efficient but did not rush. He gave us his name in case we have any questions, and thoroughly explained all the amenities and traps (i.e. don't touch anything in the minibar because it has censors! take advantage of our complimentary acura car service! Lauren, the concierge will help you if you have any questions! Have an apple!).
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: In the lobby on the way to the rooms was a dispenser of water flavored with fresh lemons and mint as well as glasses of sparkling wine. All complimentary.
reviews.title: This is NOT a W Hotel. Total rip off. Hated it.
Oh what a honeymoon.....
reviews.text: We were staying on the 6th floor. The hallway was not as snazzy as the lobby but the room made up for it. After all of the reviews, we were expecting a dirty little closet but were pleasantly surprised. Clean, modern, and functional. Decor was modern - steel, purples, gray, dark wood - with a somewhat provocative (depending on how you looked at it) picture hanging over the tidy little queen bed. The bed was extremely comfortable and the linens pristine. Bathroom had a fancy new shower and bliss toiletries. Room also had a flat screen TV. The closet was narrow but well lighted and was big enough for us to store our bags and had lots of hangers plus twoi bathrobes. Might not be big enough for big suitcases. View was a bunch of brick walls. I have paid far more for far less both in NYC, Europe, and even parts of Asia.

Room okay, mattress not great. Elevator ridiculously black so you can't see to insert your room card to operate the damn elevator. V. expensive for what the hotel offers. Staff trying desperately to be cool but come across as charmless, unhelpful and NY rude. Would I stay there again? N.O. not at their prices.
reviews.title: too cool for skool

reviews.text: I was in town for the NY Marathon this past weekend and stayed at the W. The hotel is beautiful - very relaxing decor and the staff were excellent. Our room was not ready around 12 pm (guaranteed checkin isn't until 3 anyway) but I had my 5 year old with me and we both needed to sleep! The W gave us a room to rest in until our (bigger) room was ready - which was awesome!
reviews.title: The W was way beyond my expectations!

reviews.text: We ordered a cot for my daughter, which my husband ended up sleeping on because it was so comfy. After the marathon, we had already checked out, but they kept our luggage and allowed me to go to the spa area/showers to shower and clean up before getting on the plain for home. What excellent service - we will definitely go back and have joined Starwood Hotels Frequent Guest program.
reviews.title: Trendy Hotel on Lexington Ave with detail to customer service
Understand before you go...
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a single night in October 2009. The location was fantastic as I had a meeting on 3rd Ave. I selected this location because of its proximity to a client's office. The room was approximately 200 square feet as is typical of mid-cost hotels in Manhattan. Upon arrival the reception staff was quick and attentive to my needs. Check-in was quick and effortless. I enjoyed room service during my stay- it was quick and tasty. My single complaint about the hotel was that the heat in my room did not go off during my entire stay which required me to open the windows. The front desk staff was alerted to this issue and I was told that the soonest that maintenance could take a look at the issue was the following morning. Since I was only staying for a single night, I didn't make a fuss of the issue and decided to sleep with the windows open. During the night, I enjoyed the sounds of the city and slept like a baby.
I enjoyed this hotel and will stay at it in the future.
reviews.title: The whole hotel is too dark!!!
Fantastic!
reviews.text: We went to spend a weekend in NYC and after looking around, we settled for the W on lexington street. Very convenient location. The hotel was buzzing at checkin time (around 3pm on a Friday afternoon) but the staff was very helpful. They took our luggage up for us, and greeted us with some champagne (ok, in plastic flutes, but still, it was unexpected). The Fantastic Suite was an upgrade from the Spectacular Room (which we haven't seen) and we were very pleased with it. It's just nice to have a living room in addition to the bedroom. The size of the suite was quite acceptable. We loved the modern decor and the bed was very comfortable, with clean linens, towels somewhat plush and the robe de chambre seemed comfy. All the windows in the bedroom were also a plus and the television mounted on a post was quite convenient. The shower was nice, and everything was very clean. We used the concierge service quite a bit and got good recommendations overall. The taxi ride from there to Times Square was roughly 10$. I would definitely go back, but might try another of their location. We also liked the fact that we could leave our luggage at the reception on our last day so we could visit the city without having to carry them until ready to leave.

reviews.title: WWWW innner...
reviews.text: We did ask for a mini-fridge on Friday night, and after calling a second time, were told by the 'whenever, wherever' staff that it was on its way, only to later on receive a call from them telling us they were out for the day... I don't mind them being out of mini-fridge since we asked last minute, but telling us it was on the way is just not good practice... We did get one on the next day.

reviews.title: Hip and Modern Hotel wirh Excellent Service
reviews.text: We've also encountered an unexpected situation with room service. Happens that they were 'in the middle of their cleaning' when we came back mid-day for a nap, but there were not in the room. So after placing the 'do-not-disturb' sign, we happily napped, only to be called by room service asking if they could come and complete their cleaning. I've politely explained we would be out after 2pm, but still, the person asked again if they could complete the cleaning. Maybe a language barrier but I had to make it clear that we'd be in the room until 2pm. In all honesty, I really wouldn't expect a call from room service if they see that the 'do-not-disturb' sign has been installed. As I said, this was rather unexpected.

reviews.title: Modern hotel centrally located
reviews.text: The hotel club (Whiskey something I think) seemed very nice, with comfy leather couches. We went there only for a few minutes, but they were enjoyable. I'd make a point of going there if you like lounges.

reviews.title: Very good hotel
reviews.text: However, in the end, I give thumbs up to the NYC W Lexington street.

reviews.title: Cool with Good Location
reviews.text: Very nice hotel in a great walking area. The rooms are not very big but a "Wow" room or up should be more than accomodating for two people. It has a very cool vibe, particularly at night with the Whiskey Blue bar and the lobby bar, drinks are pretty steep. The W concierges are the best, got us into a couple great clubs without waiting and recommended some very good restaurants. I would stay here again.

reviews.title: Agressive porters at this pretentious hotel
reviews.text: Hello, I stayed here in March 2005 at a rate of $280 a night, and found the in room amenities wonderful (mini Bliss goodie bags). The robe in the room was also lovely. The room was very small, but I was not expecting anything bigger for New York. However, please can I draw your attention to the porters. On checking out, I walked over to the left luggage desk and left my small day pack for a few hours while I looked around. When I returned to the hotel, I collected my bag and went to leave the hotel for the airport. Ordinarily I would have left a small tip, but not having any small bills, and having dropped the bag in myself, I didn't think it was too rude not to leave anything.

I had almost reached the front door, when I head a loud shout: "excuse me!, excuse me!". I turned around to find an angry porter. "Yes", I said. "Was everything okay with the service?". "Yes", I said. "If you have a problem with the service, you need to tell me so I can fix it". "Okay then", I said, and went on my way.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable, excellent concierge staff

reviews.text: So, if you don't fancy being accosted by an agressive porter and being shouted at in reception (oh sorry, this hotel likes to call it "the welcome desk"), think again before dealing with them. Perhaps management could place a little warning sign for European guests warning them of the requirement to pay per bag left with the porters.
reviews.title: The W Hotel - OK but not great

reviews.text: p.s. my expense department is still querying my breakfast charge of $42 for oatmeal and carrot juice.
reviews.title: Lovely and chic - great place to stay

reviews.text: I stayed for two nights on Dec. 28 and 29 right before the New Years Holiday. The hotel is in a great location and the lobby is very nice. I used points because at this time of year, all New York hotels are overpriced. I would not call this hotel 5 star, but I had a pleasant stay. I was in the room only to sleep, but I will say that the heating system does not work well... the room was so hot, I asked for them to lower it. They told me how to do it myself, but the vent was stuck and I could not do it. It took two phone calls before someone came to the room, but even after it was fixed, the room was still very warm. I did not use the restaurants or any amenities at the hotel. They did serve some delicious brownies and hot cider in the lobby in the evening. All in all, I would stay here again, because of the convenient location, but I would not pay a high price as I think there are better deals in NYC.
reviews.title: W Hotel Lexington Ave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The W hotel chain has created a magnificent marketing brand. When you set food in the lobby of the W at Lex and 49th the brand is perfectly on display with its energenic and busy bar to its sleek and ever so cool front desk. One can't help but think that this is "the place" to stay and be seen in midtown Manhatten. Wrong. It all ends with and in the lobby. Past the lobby this W hotel might as well be a highway motel. The rooms are old, not particularly clean, dark, bleak and just plain worn out. The photos someone else posted are accurate. There are at least 3 better hotels, The Marriott, DoubleTree and Waldorf Astoria, in the same area. What the W does well in other cities is not duplicated here. The was our first and last visit and was based on an American Express promotion. We will and you should stay elsewhere. You know, one would think someone with Starwood would review the comments on this page and act. That speaks volumes for Starwood and its new CEO.
reviews.title: Not the W hotel chain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited this hotel for a four-day, three night extended pre-holiday weekend. I really didn't have the issues that so many previous reviewers had. I've stayed at several other properties in the W chain, so I was eager to try the original, flagship property on Lexington Ave. I wasn't disappointed - as I had a great room and great service in all aspects.
reviews.title: Fabulous, Hip NYC experience

likes.disliked: — No lighting in closet, difficult to find the corrent shirt/tie/socks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoy the attitude and theming of all of the W hotels (each property is very unique, but the general philosophy and experience is consistent), and if you go in expecting that experience, you won't be disappointed. Spend some time exploring the W Hotels web site before you book a stay at a W. If the vibe isn't one that pleases you, you may want to go elsewhere. The look and style of the W New York was great - I loved the "elements" theming of water, fire, earth. I guess that lots of people just don't 'get it', but it is so nice to live your life as art, which is what W seems to be trying to do.
reviews.title: Suited our purpose

reviews.text: I was most impressed by the friendliness and attitudes of the bell staff, the welcome desk staff, and everyone else that I encountered at the W, and everyone appearred energetic and professional. I love how W staff consistently try to treat you as a friend or associate - they seem interested in your story - what makes you unique - and I'm sure that isn't an easy stance to pull off in a large, big city hotel like the W New York - but they do suceed, and if you willing participate in the relationship, you'll have a great time. I was very fortunate to be upgraded to a corner suite, - the room was lovely, with a seperate bedroom and sitting room. and a large bathroom with combo tub/shower. All things in the room were fine and in working condition, the bed, linens, and Bliss products were decadent. I took breakfast three days at the Heartbeat restaurant, which was nice, in a very lovely setting. The restaraunt was closed in afternoon/evenings for some upgrades and remodeling, so I didn't get to try any other meals than breakfast - but since there are so many wonderful options in NYC, this certainly wasn't viwed as a problem. I also had a fabulous time at the Bliss Spa, it gives a vibe very similar to that of the W. Also had a great holiday cocktail in the Living Room where I chatted with some interesting and convivial people - just like a hotel lobby should be for. The W Hotel offered nice treats throughout the day in the Living Room area(chocolate kisses, brownies, blondies, hot cider, etc.). Security was very evident in the hotel in the evenings, so I think anyone would feel secure staying here.
reviews.title: Good location, but overpriced for poor quality

reviews.text: We stayed in New York for a week for a international security conference in October and through the convention booked at what we thought would be a memorable stay at the W Hotel on Lexington. It also coincided with my partner's birthday and thought that this would be memorable hip place to celebrate. Well the bar area is definetly happening but we were most disappointed about the size and quality of the rooms. There was not even a set of drawers to put your sweaters, socks or underwear away. We had only a cloth shoe organizer inside the dinky closet to store our personal belongings. The carpet had stains and rug pulls in it and our two pieces of luggage had to be stacked on top of each other due to lack of space. This facility needs an upgrade of its rooms.....we stayed the year before at the Ameritania on 230 West 54 Street which was a quarter of the price and twice the space...go there and hop over to the W Hotel for drinks and you will have the best of both worlds. The salt on the wound is that their sales department offered us a credit of points but this amounts to less than one night after spending close to $400 per night. Not good enuff!!!!!
reviews.title: Claustrophobic and unkempt

likes.liked: — The bar scene was exciting and throughout the whole week a very interesting place
likes.disliked: — Rooms were too small and for $400 per night unsatisfactory to what is in the marketplace

reviews.text: This is the hotel with the worst reviews I have ever seen on Tripadvisor. To my relief they weren't totally realised, yes the rooms are minute (or cosy as the W staff say) and room furnishings are tired but the common areas and lobby are fine, the concierge sevice first class and we found our room quiet and comfortable. We stayed 2 nights, it would definitely be claustrophobic to stay more. I do not regret staying here but would not do so again. It's just not up to the mark.
reviews.title: mediocre but not too bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a 6 night stay in W New York.
reviews.title: Nice surprise
Small, dark and depressing...
reviews.text: I was a little bit worried after reading all the reviews, but I found the hotel very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The position is great, you can walk almost everywhere in midtown and there is a plenty of nice restarant near the hotel.
reviews.title: Don't believe all you read!

reviews.text: After doing my homework in order to find the perfect place to stay in NYC, I decided to take a very good deal with travelocity, which I found through tripadvisor. My son and I had a very nice time at this stylish hotel. the staff was very welcoming and helpful (they even did my return flight check-in for me). The room, although small, was calming, clean and noise-free. Their restaurant serves great food, but beware of the pricey menu. The location is perfect (very close to Rockerfeller Center, Grand Central Station, 5th ave) and there are many options for dining at a lower cost. The cab from La Guardia was 30 dollars. We were very pleased and would definetely stay at the W @ Lexington Ave again.
reviews.title: Relaxing with a cool vibe

likes.liked: — Relaxing rooms; welcoming staff and concierge

reviews.title: Love this hotel!!!!!
reviews.text: The W hotel is the only hotel I stay at in New York City. I travel a lot and from personal experience i definitely recommend the W hotel! The staff were very friendly and energetic, the rooms were always clean. And you cant beat the BLISS products they give you in the hotel rooms! They are awesome! I wont ever stay anywhere else in NYC but the W hotel! People complain about the rooms but PLEASE its NYC!!! Every hotel in NYC will have the same size rooms......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on New Year's eve. I had Starwood points and was able to secure a room essentially for free.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, good location

reviews.text: Check in was very quick, and our room was a decent size (for NYC). We had a queen bed with pretty nice bedding. The bathroom was on the small side, but looked as if it had been remodelled recently. The room and bathroom were both very clean. Bathroom came equipped with Bliss spa products which were pretty nice as well.
reviews.title: This is it?

reviews.text: Location of the hotel was great, close to a subway line and very close to Radio City Music Hall where we were going to a concert that night. The bellmen outside were very courteous and helped us get a cab very quickly both times we needed one.
reviews.title: Fun Vibe, Desperately Needs Update
Great Serivce
reviews.text: I arrived at the W on Lex after midnight after a flight. My reservations were mistakenly made for the following night and the hotel desk receptionist said they were completely sold out. I asked him to check with the Manager and he took care of the issue and provided me a room. I travel frequently and stay at W hotels when I can. That the Manager was able to resolve my issue (which was my fault) within 5 minutes is excellent.

reviews.title: Trendy, stylish accommodation
reviews.text: My partner and I spent two nights here and really enjoyed the hotel. The decor and styling was fresh and contemporary, and the rooms were fantastic. The beds are particularly great. The hotel is stylish, practical and has a great energy. The service staff were a mixed bunch - the valet was really friendly and helpful, while the bag clerk was somewhat dour and glum, but as far as hotels go, W was a winner.

reviews.title: Timothy James Consulting Winners trip
reviews.text: Have just returned from NYC on a winners trip for Timothy James Consulting with 12 of our very best consultants. The hotel was fantastic and a great location we were "right in the very heart of it". The hotel bar next door Whiskey Blue was really lively and definitely worth a visit. If you want a great hotel in a great location that is affordable then look no further. Would certainly go back.

reviews.title: Swell Joint, but Loud
reviews.text: So, there are definitely a number of reasons why we liked this hotel: it's in a swish Manhattan neighborhood and convenient to lots of things - Central Park, Grand Central Station, Madison Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center, the subway, etc. (admittedly, being in NYC and the neighborhood are kinda "gimmes"); the front desk and concierge staff were nice, friendly, and accommodating; the hotel is swanky, has nice amenities (e.g., loungy bar, Bliss products), is very clean and well kept; we took a "Mega" room and it was the same size as a standard room in, e.g., Boston, Chicago, San Francisco, etc.; and there is complimentary car service available (we didn't need it, but that's a nice plus all the same).

reviews.title: Amazing Experience
reviews.text: The things that rankled a wee bit? Well, it's truly loud - the lobby music, the "party" atmosphere (i.e., lots of guests returning to rooms at 4:00 a.m. a la Vegas), and street sounds didn't both us, they were actually nice touches (the drinky guests a bit less than the other two things, but let's face it: most of us self-selecting W guests have likely been the drinky guests ourselves at one point or nine) - but the lobby music reaching our 6th floor room (thumping bass and drums) at 12:30 a.m. was a drag. Also, at this price point they shouldn't jack guests up, e.g.: charging for WiFi, outrageous mini-bar prices, etc. I think this would have rankled more if one had paid only 10%-15% less and taken a "Cozy" room.

This W really is not up to snuff. Rooms and baths are small, which is expected in NYC, but also shabby and outdated. It's as though all the attention has been lavished upon making a cool lobby and bar. The staff is very helpful, however--it's just that a renovation is desperately needed.
reviews.title: Shabby rooms, good staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a frequent Starwood traveler and I've stayed at Westins and Ws all over the world. So you can believe me when I tell you: stay away from the W New York.
reviews.title: The worst W you'll ever stay at
Consistent NYC Hotel Experience
reviews.text: A few low-lights from my trip there last weekend:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * The first room they put us in smelled strongly of ammonia and they wouldn't give us a different room. A technician did show up to change the shower curtain which turned out to be the issue.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE ROOMS

likes.disliked: — The room, terribley outdated and run down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * They called me early the next morning and WOKE ME UP to tell me that now I had to change rooms because of the renovations work and that I would need to pack up my bags.
reviews.title: Great location, rooms need some work!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a bargain for a Starwood hotel, if you belong to their Starwood Preferred Guest program. We used 4800 points and paid $90. We found check-in very efficient, got a slightly upgraded room too. Our room on the 8th floor was on the Lexington Ave. side of the hotel, there was significant traffic noise as a result. The room was modest in size, which is not unusual, in my experience, in New York. The lobby area is quite attractive. The elevators were a little on the slow side, and required the insertion of your room key to operate.
reviews.title: Excellent use of cash&points

reviews.text: This is a very cool hotel, but the rooms are painfully small. Really painfully small. I've been here three times and you can barely move around in some of them. And they have those old fashioned, really noisy free standing wall/window based air conditioners and heaters. Hard to believe for the prices. Food is very good in room service and restaurants. Staff is good, but a bit too into how cool they think they are.
reviews.title: It hurts to be cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 4nite stay in the W on Lex and I was really wary about staying there having read all the bad reviews beforehand. - but we had nothing to be concerned about. I really think some people just complain about anything for the sake of complaining!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, great location!

reviews.text: Yes we got the hotel at a great deal and yes the walls in the rooms could do with a bit of paint but other than that we had no issues.
reviews.title: trendy hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We turned up at 12pm and although we had requested an early check in time at 1pm we were intially told we could not check in till 3pm however as we were storing our bags in the lobby to go walkabout a lovely gentleman came over and told us they had found a room for us and we could check in straightaway.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: So much was wrong with our stay, I hardly know where to start. The main problems were;
reviews.title: Dreadful - do not give these people your money!

reviews.text: - my bedding was dirty, I had to report it twice before anybody did anything about it
reviews.title: Disappointing hotel, would not return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - when you check in, no member of staff bothers to tell you anything about the hotel, you're merely handed a key (where's the gym? The spa? The restaurant? How do we operate the damn lift?!) and there's no information in the rooms to help either
reviews.title: Stay at the other Ws - this one is the worst of the bunch!

likes.liked: — The lobby bar and the toiletries

reviews.text: - the room was like a sauna so we had to use the unfeasibly loud air-con (loud enough to keep both of us awake), not what one expects in New York City in January!
reviews.title: Extremely dissapointed

reviews.text: - the plug didn't fit the bath and the water in the sink didn't drain properly
reviews.title: loved the W!

likes.liked: — the location and trendy lobby bar

reviews.text: I stayed at the W New York for one night last August. Having waited in line at immigration at JFK for two hours, I was ready to collapse into bed upon arrival at the hotel. On arriving at the hotel, I was practically thrown out of the cab by the waiting hordes outside. I looked in vain for someone to help me with my suitcase (it was heavy!) and in the end a passer-by took pity on me and helped me inside the hotel. I left my suitcase at reception to be brought up, but waited almost an hour in my room for it, before going back to reception to fetch it myself. The receptionist promised me a free breakfast as compensation for the poor service, but after I checked out I noticed I had paid for my breakfast. The room was nicely furnished but tiny - any longer than one night would have been claustrophobic. The lobby was more like a nightclub than a hotel. Bliss toiletries in the bathroom were a nice touch. The guys in the room next door decided to party all night, and the walls were too thin to block out the noise. I couldn't wait to check out and won't be coming back. I emailed the manager afterwards with my complaint and never heard back.
reviews.title: Noisy and understaffed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was a little nervous about what we had booked!!
reviews.title: Loved the W hotel, would definately go back!

reviews.text: We stayed at the W hotel for 2 nights. We arrived at the hotel around 3pm and at check we were told our room was not ready but as they knew we had been on a long journey from London they did what they could to re arrange the rooms so we could go straight up to the room.
reviews.title: Poor fire safety

reviews.text: We stayed in one of the Mega rooms and we were pleased with what we had. the room was modern and a nice size the bathroom was clean and crisp.
reviews.title: No Fuss Buzz

likes.disliked: — a little dated for the hype

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very buzzy and had a great atmosphere. A great place to stay if you want to get into the New York atmosphere and also a great location.
reviews.title: very contemporary /great location
Love it!
reviews.text: I love the W in Manhattan! It's a fun, hip place to be and stay! I always have the best time.

Superclean room, quiet, dark with a spectacular bed - that's all I needed and got. Even though I didn't go to NYC to sleep, a good sleep is super important. I wasn't crazy about midtown/east but subway transportation is abundant to everywhere. The 3 for 2 promo I got made the whole thing a deal. The public areas were trendy; I'm not. I had no need for them anyway.
reviews.title: Weekend getway for one ...

reviews.text: We got booked for two nights into W through priceline so only after paying we started reading reviews and our hearts sunk. We prepared ourselves for Fawlty Towers experience. However it was very good and the only complaint we had was key cards that required several tries in the elevator and the door. The good things included: an unexpected room upgrade, an early check in, and a very comfortable room. I agree that rooms are small but if you only spend nights there the square footage matters little. The good size bathroom had more value for us. There was one erroneous charge for the fridge content (it was triggered by us moving a pop can inside) but it was promptly reversed. Overall I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Positively surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I might be biased to this hotel, but during this last stay there I got engaged! <3 My fiancee and I stayed 2 nights this past weekend and had a great time! We had a beautiful room with a balcony overlooking the chrystler building.
reviews.title: A romantic getaway!

reviews.text: The front desk staff was very nice, and even came up to our room to take engagement pictures on the balcony!
reviews.title: Comfortable bed

reviews.text: I stayed at the W Hotel from May 06 thru 14, 2005. Please bear with me, as my review is in two parts--and I got to see two separate rooms. Also note that there are multiple locations to this brand in the city. I stayed at the W Hotel location on Lexington Ave.
reviews.title: W Hotel - 541 Lexington Ave - Part 1
just right
reviews.text: I arrived at 5:30am on 05/06/2005. I told the desk clerk upon arrival that I would understand if they did not have a room available for early check-in. I also requested a corner room, if available, as I was going to be there for a whole week. She was able to provide a room, so I check in. Upon inspection, I was dissatisfied. First, the room door openned to the elevator landing; secord, the room was quite small. (see photos)

reviews.title: Caution
reviews.text: I went back to the desk and stated that I didn't want to spoil the room, and was willing to wait until noon, to see if anything better openned up. To my delight, she offered that I should keep the room assigned as a courtesy room and that should make myself comfortable. I could return at noon, and she would change rooms if an improvement could be made.

I will remark at this time, that the room was small, and so was the bathroom. This hotel room was about the same size as the room that I got when staying at the Radisson down the block (during a previous trip to the city). Also, the closet of this first room was very small, and there were no drawers.
reviews.title: Surprisingly (and sadly) just plain awful
Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: (end - part 1) pchnmain

My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the W Hotel and were quite impressed. We stayed in a "Wonderful" room which was small but all of the amenities were top notch. My favorite was the shower head, while my girlfriend's was the Bliss bathroom products. This hotel's Midtown location was great for visiting New York and a lot of the city's sites are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Hip and Young Hotel
Lousy hotel
reviews.text: I will note that this hotel is for the younger travelers. The hotel lobby after 5pm is very busy and there is electronic music playing in the elavator at all times. Being that both my girlfriend and I are 30 years old we enjoyed it.

reviews.title: 'W' Hotel, style or substance?
reviews.text: My only complaint was that after our luggage was delivered from the airport the hotel did not bring us our bags as soon as it arrived. After I called the front desk to ask the whereabouts of our luggage it took them 15 minutes to bring it up. Besides that everyone was very helpful from the concierage to the bellhop.

reviews.title: New York Minute!
reviews.text: Also we did go to Caffe Linda around the corner as a previous reviewer had suggested and it was great. Very good food and very inexpensive for New York.

reviews.title: New Attitude at the "W"
reviews.text: I would definately stay at this hotel again when I go to New York.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the smallest room i ever seen. smallest bathroom were i ever had a shower. the tv do not work, if u touch things - just if u touch it - you will pay for it!! nice location. at the same price you can find better places around
reviews.title: nyc hotel

reviews.text: rooms were too dark. in fact, the entire hotel was pretty dark. our room was so heavily perfumed, i thought i would have an asthma attack (even though i don't have asthma!). the smell was overwhelming. we asked the front desk if anything could be done, but we were told that housekeeping sprays the rooms when they clean them. no offer to change rooms, no apology. on a good note, the beds were very comfortable and since i used points, we got our room for $90 which is unheard of in the city. overall, who can complain about a $90 room, but i would NEVER pay more than that to stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: dark & stinky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel rocks. I have always had a great experience at W's but this was a cut above. i made a special room request that was honored immediately and graciously. The room was awesome and the customer service top-notch. It was a special occassion for us and the hotel GM surprised us with something really special. Great location-great experience-great stay!!! A million thanks to the GM and his staff.
reviews.title: WOW IS REALLY WOW AT THE W

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been long time fans of the W hotel being loyal starwood preferred guests. In fact, we stayed at THIS W hotel when it first opened back in the 90's. Forgot how well-located this particular W is given all the W options in NYC - chose it since our focus was midtown, Upper East Side and Central Park. Delighted to see it's been beautifully well-kept. We've noticed erratic service from W to W, sometimes bordering on over-the-top snobbiness and surliness. Happy to report, this W really shined with welcoming and professional service at the front desk and concierge desk (very helpful especially during super busy weekend with marathon, rock concert, halloween, etc.), and a friendly, attentive and thorough housekeeping staff. The room was well-appointed and very tidy. We had a "wonderful" room which I think is a smaller room -- however, we were only there for 2 nights, so it was fine. The bathroom was VERY spacious with a roomy and luxurious shower & the standard "W" Bliss toiletries (LOVE!). We had an issue with our heater being WAY TOO LOUD, but engineering fixed this quite swiftly for which we were quite grateful. There's a little computer in the lobby that allows you to check in for your flight which is a nice touch. The lobby lounge was inviting and cozy. While there was no coffee maker in the room, I believe you could order one up. Nonetheless, it's too bad they just don't offer free coffee in the lobby for a bit in the morning? We also tried out the Acura car service offer and were almost completely put-off by the booking lady's pretentiousness or crabbiness (too many inane questions from the throngs?) -- however, glad we did it, the experience is MUCH more relaxing than a typical NYC cab ride (especially since we love Acura!) One tip, avoid the W store if you have little patience for overt snobbiness -- The sales staff in the boutique were completely obnoxious and rude -- to the point where I felt like slapping one of them for being utterly disrespectful and "holier" than thou. (What are they thinking? A distasteful slice of "Mean Girls") I'd like to say the treatment was limited to me, but with the exception of another customer that looked just like the sales girls, they treated others universally meanly. Other than this sour point, I wouldrecommend the W New York!
reviews.title: More substance than the typical W, welcoming...except for the W Store & Acura lady!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We won this hotel via Priceline. I figured I couldn't go wrong with a 4* hotel in NYC, and my heart kind of sank a bit when I came here after winning the hotel. However, after reading the reviews, we prepared ourselves for a small room and that's exactly what we got.
reviews.title: Excellent location, bring a flashlight, and come prepared for a small room

aka: w New York Hotel New York City
description: W New York Hotel is renovated with completely new rooms and suites. Located in the heart of midtown, offers travelers a perfect refuge - unwind at the Bliss Spa.
